content.description:
Magnoque tumultu 
aequora miscet et undas nunc ad litora volvit. 
Parvulaparvulus, -a, -um, adj. = parvus, -a, -um cumbacumba, -ae, f. = navis, -is gemitgemo, -ere: to groan fatali verbereverber, -eris, n.: beating laesa, 
et nautae timido superos clamore petebant.
content.question: In the passage, the sailors

choices.label: are terrified and about to be drowned in a storm
are unaware of the gods’ desire to see them shipwrecked
have made a choice to sail through rough seas in order to reach the shore
confidently watch from the shore as their enemies are overwhelmed in rough seas

content.answer: are terrified and about to be drowned in a storm
